    • How to to do fuzzy membership based river corridor delineation

How to to do fuzzy membership based river corridor delineation

fuzzyDelineation.Rmd
#library(riverMapper)

For river corridor mapping purposes, it is necessary to delineate the part of a landscape being connected to the hydrological or hydromorphological processes of the active channel. This riparian zone is characterized by a blurred boundary zone rather than sharp boundary. Fuzzy logic can capture this characteristic (Betz et al., 2018). RiverMapper implements this approach by computing membership functions of different morphometric indices and combining them to a single riparian zone membership index where 0 means not connected at all and 1 fully connected to the active channel.

First step is to compute the indices. To provide a function for this, riverMapper integrates SAGA GIS. Anyway, indices can be provided externally as well and computed with any GIS software as long as they can be stored as raster files and have the same resolution and extent.

#library(riverMapper)
#computeIndices()

Developed by Florian Betz.
